ground_truth: Malcolm points to the huge framed certificate propped up on a dining room chair, which is printed on aged parchment-type paper and housed in a polished mahogany frame. He slips on the sweatshirt as Anna's attention slowly moves to the framed certificate. She leans forward in her seat, reads the certificate out loud while Malcolm tries to tickle her, and then turns to Malcolm, who smiles. Anna takes Malcolm's hands and holds them steady, then lets go, her eyes emotional. Anna leans towards him, and they hold each other tight as their sweet laughter fills the house. Two giggling shadows appear in the bedroom doorway, trying to turn on the light, when a stranger slowly looks up for the first time, his eyes locking on Malcolm. The stranger suddenly moves forward into the doorway, causing Malcolm to stumble back onto the edge of the bed. Anna sees the stranger for the first time, her face draining of color. The stranger looks at Malcolm, half grins, as Anna's expression instantly changes. The stranger turns and glares at Malcolm, who stops all movement and stands. Tears fall down the stranger's face as Malcolm looks up at the sound of those words, and Vincent Gray stares with surprise through his tears. Malcolm lets out a deep breath like he just emerged from deep waters as Vincent's eyes burn at Malcolm, fully crying now. Vincent turns to the sink, his hand goes in, and he turns around, raises a gun at Malcolm, and fires. Malcolm clutches his stomach and folds like a rag doll onto the bed, and Vincent instantly moves the gun to his own head. Handwritten notes fill every line as Malcolm glances through the page and sees words and phrases circled throughout the file. Sitting on a sidewalk bench facing a row of brownstone homes across the street, Malcolm gazes blankly at the brownstones until a door opens, bringing him out of his trance as Cole Sear steps out of his front door. Cole is a munchkin of a boy with large, black eyes that seem to take in everything around him, his hair dark with a small patch of jet white on the side. Cole carefully locks the door behind him, reaches into his pocket, and slips on a pair of very large glasses that look comical on him. Malcolm rises to his feet, but when he looks up, Cole is gone. Malcolm barely catches a glimpse of the boy as Cole runs at full speed down the street and turns the corner. Stuffing the file in his bag, Malcolm starts running too, hauling down the sidewalk, and comes to a hard stop at a street intersection as Cole sprints across the empty lot, reaching the doors of a building.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: Malcolm gestures to the massive bordered diploma supported up on a dining room seat, which is inscribed on aged parchment-like paper and enclosed in a glossy mahogany border. He slips on the pullover as Anna's focus slowly shifts to the bordered diploma. She leans forward in her spot, recites the diploma out loud while Malcolm attempts to tickle her, and then turns to Malcolm, who grins. Anna takes Malcolm's hands and grips them steady, then lets go, her eyes expressive. Anna leans towards him, and they embrace each other tight as their tender laughter fills the residence. Two chuckling silhouettes emerge in the bedroom entrance, attempting to turn on the illumination, when a newcomer slowly glances up for the first time, his eyes fastening on Malcolm. The newcomer suddenly advances into the entrance, causing Malcolm to stumble back onto the brink of the bed. Anna sees the newcomer for the first time, her face losing color. The newcomer gazes at Malcolm, half smirks, as Anna's demeanor instantly shifts. The newcomer turns and glowers at Malcolm, who halts all motion and stands. Tears descend down the newcomer's visage as Malcolm glances up at the tone of those words, and Vincent Gray stares with amazement through his tears. Malcolm exhales a profound sigh like he just surfaced from deep waters as Vincent's eyes blaze at Malcolm, fully weeping now. Vincent turns to the basin, his hand goes in, and he spins around, raises a firearm at Malcolm, and discharges. Malcolm clutches his abdomen and collapses like a rag doll onto the bed, and Vincent instantly moves the firearm to his own cranium. Handwritten annotations fill every line as Malcolm scans through the page and sees words and phrases circled throughout the dossier. Seated on a pavement bench facing a row of brownstone residences across the avenue, Malcolm stares blankly at the brownstones until a portal opens, bringing him out of his stupor as Cole Sear steps out of his entryway. Cole is a munchkin of a lad with large, black eyes that seem to take in everything around him, his hair dark with a small patch of jet white on the flank. Cole carefully locks the portal behind him, reaches into his pocket, and slips on a pair of very large spectacles that appear humorous on him. Malcolm rises to his feet, but when he glances up, Cole is vanished. Malcolm barely captures a glimpse of the lad as Cole dashes at full speed down the avenue and turns the corner. Stuffing the dossier in his bag, Malcolm starts running too, racing down the pavement, and comes to a hard stop at a street junction as Cole sprints across the vacant lot, reaching the portals of a structure.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: The huge framed certificate, which is printed on aged parchment-type paper and housed in a polished mahogany frame, is pointed to by Malcolm as it is propped up on a dining room chair. The sweatshirt is slipped on by him as Anna's attention is slowly moved to the framed certificate. Her seat is leaned forward in, the certificate is read out loud by her while Malcolm tries to tickle her, and then she turns to Malcolm, who is smiling. Malcolm's hands are taken and held steady by Anna, who then lets go, her eyes emotional. He is leaned towards by Anna, and they are held each other tight as the house is filled with their sweet laughter. In the bedroom doorway, two giggling shadows appear, trying to turn on the light, when a stranger slowly looks up for the first time, locking his eyes on Malcolm. The doorway is suddenly moved into by the stranger, causing Malcolm to stumble back onto the edge of the bed. The stranger is seen by Anna for the first time, her face drained of color. Malcolm is looked at by the stranger, half grinning, as Anna's expression instantly changes. Malcolm is turned to and glared at by the stranger, and all movement is stopped by Malcolm, who stands. The stranger's face is filled with tears as Malcolm looks up at the sound of those words, and with surprise, Vincent Gray stares through his tears. A deep breath is let out by Malcolm like he just emerged from deep waters as Vincent's eyes burn at him, fully crying now. The sink is turned to by Vincent, his hand goes in, and he turns around, raises a gun at Malcolm, and fires. Malcolm's stomach is clutched, and he folds like a rag doll onto the bed, and the gun is instantly moved to Vincent's own head by him. Every line is filled with handwritten notes as the page is glanced through by Malcolm and words and phrases circled throughout the file are seen. Facing a row of brownstone homes across the street, a sidewalk bench is sat on by Malcolm, who gazes blankly at the brownstones until a door is opened, bringing him out of his trance, as Cole Sear steps out of his front door. A munchkin of a boy with large, black eyes that seem to take in everything around him, his hair dark with a small patch of jet white on the side, is Cole. The door is carefully locked behind him by Cole, who reaches into his pocket and slips on a pair of very large glasses that look comical on him. Malcolm rises to his feet, but when he looks up, Cole is gone. A glimpse of the boy is barely caught by Malcolm as Cole runs at full speed down the street and turns the corner. The file is stuffed in his bag by Malcolm, who starts running too, hauling down the sidewalk, and he comes to a hard stop at a street intersection as Cole sprints across the empty lot, reaching the doors of a building.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: Malcolm gestures to a large framed certificate on a dining chair, printed on aged parchment and encased in a mahogany frame. As Anna's attention shifts to the certificate, she reads it aloud while Malcolm attempts to tickle her. They share an emotional moment, holding each other as laughter fills the house. Two shadows appear in the doorway as a stranger locks eyes with Malcolm. The stranger advances, making Malcolm stumble onto the bed. Anna sees the stranger, becoming pale. The stranger grins at Malcolm, changing Anna's expression. Tears stream down as Vincent Gray stares at Malcolm, who exhales deeply. Vincent turns, grabs a gun, and fires at Malcolm, who collapses onto the bed. Vincent then turns the gun on himself. Malcolm, sitting on a bench, glances at notes filled with circled phrases. He stares at brownstones until Cole Sear emerges. Cole locks his door, dons oversized glasses, and vanishes as Malcolm rises. Malcolm catches a glimpse of Cole sprinting away, stuffs the file in his bag, and runs to an intersection while Cole reaches a building's doors.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Malcolm points to a large framed certificate on a dining chair, printed on aged paper in a mahogany frame. He dons a sweatshirt as Anna reads the certificate aloud, then holds Malcolm's hands, eyes emotional, before they embrace amid laughter. Two giggling shadows appear in the bedroom doorway when a stranger locks eyes with Malcolm. The stranger moves, causing Malcolm to stumble onto the bed's edge. Anna sees the stranger, her face pales, as the stranger half grins and then tears fall. Vincent Gray surprises them with a gun, shooting Malcolm, who collapses. Vincent aims the gun at himself. Malcolm sees handwritten notes on a file, and on a sidewalk bench, he watches a row of brownstones until Cole Sear emerges and locks his door. A small boy with striking features, Cole dons oversized glasses. Malcolm stands, realizing Cole has vanished. He glimpses Cole running down the street, so Malcolm runs, stopping at an intersection as Cole races to a building.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: Malcolm gestures with a sense of pride and satisfaction towards the enormous, distinguished-looking framed certificate that is precariously propped up on a dining room chair. This certificate, which exudes an air of importance and accomplishment, is printed on paper that resembles aged parchment and is encased in an elegant, polished mahogany frame. As he slips on a comfortable sweatshirt, Anna's attention gradually shifts towards the certificate, intrigued by its presence. She leans forward in her seat with interest, reading the contents of the certificate aloud while Malcolm playfully attempts to tickle her. When she turns to him, he greets her with a warm smile. Anna gently takes Malcolm's hands in hers, holding them securely for a moment before releasing them, her eyes brimming with emotion. Leaning towards him, they embrace closely, sharing a moment of affection as their joyous laughter resonates throughout the house, bringing warmth to the atmosphere. Meanwhile, two giggling shadows, belonging to children, appear with playful mischief in the bedroom doorway, clearly in an attempt to turn on the light. At this moment, a stranger, who has gone unnoticed until now, slowly lifts his gaze for the first time, his eyes locking onto Malcolm with an intense stare. As the stranger suddenly advances forward into the doorway, Malcolm instinctively stumbles backwards, landing on the edge of the bed in a moment of surprise and vulnerability. Anna catches sight of the stranger, her face instantly losing color in a mix of fear and shock. The stranger's half-grin in Malcolm's direction changes Anna's expression instantaneously. The stranger then fixes a piercing glare at Malcolm, who becomes motionless, standing there as if frozen in time. Tears begin to cascade down the stranger's face, and Malcolm finds himself looking up at the sound of the stranger's pained words. Vincent Gray is revealed, staring through a veil of tears with an expression of surprise and anguish. Malcolm exhales deeply, almost as if he has resurfaced from the depths of an ocean, while Vincent's eyes blaze with a fiery intensity at Malcolm, now crying fully. Vincent turns towards a nearby sink, reaches in with a decisive motion, and abruptly turns around, raising a gun menacingly at Malcolm before firing. Malcolm, struck by the bullet, clutches his stomach and collapses onto the bed like a limp rag doll. In an instant, Vincent shifts the gun to his own head in a desperate move. As Malcolm later sifts through a file, he finds every line densely filled with handwritten notes, with words and phrases prominently circled and highlighted throughout the document. Seated on a sidewalk bench, facing a picturesque row of brownstone homes across the street, Malcolm stares vacantly at the brownstones until the sound of a door opening interrupts his trance. This draws his attention as Cole Sear emerges from his front door, stepping out into the world. Cole, a diminutive boy with strikingly large, dark eyes that seem to absorb everything in their path, has dark hair accented with a distinctive small patch of jet white on one side. Carefully locking the door behind him, Cole reaches into his pocket and pulls out an oversized pair of glasses, which, when slipped on, appear almost comically large for his face. Malcolm rises to his feet with intent, but as he looks up, Cole seems to have vanished. Malcolm barely catches a fleeting glimpse of the boy as Cole dashes away at an impressive speed down the street, disappearing around the corner. Hastily stuffing the file into his bag, Malcolm takes off running, sprinting down the sidewalk with urgency. He comes to an abrupt halt at a street intersection, just as Cole races across an empty lot, making his way rapidly towards the doors of a nearby building.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: Malcolm, filled with a profound sense of pride and immense satisfaction, gestures towards the large, imposing, and distinguished-looking framed certificate. This notable certificate is precariously perched on a dining room chair, and its presence demands attention. The certificate exudes a palpable air of importance and significant accomplishment and is printed on paper designed to mimic aged parchment, giving it an authentic and historical appearance. It is encased in an elegant frame made of polished mahogany, adding an additional touch of sophistication. As he nonchalantly slips on a comfortable sweatshirt, Anna's attention is gradually drawn towards the certificate. Intrigued by its presence, she leans forward in her seat, her interest piqued as she reads the contents of the certificate aloud. Meanwhile, Malcolm playfully attempts to tickle her, adding a moment of lightheartedness to the scene. When she finally turns to him, he greets her with a warm and affectionate smile. Anna gently takes Malcolm's hands in hers, holding them securely for a tender moment before she releases them, her eyes brimming with deep emotion. Leaning towards him, they embrace closely, sharing an intimate moment of genuine affection as their joyous laughter resonates throughout the house, filling the atmosphere with warmth. At the same time, two giggling shadows, belonging to children, appear with playful mischief in the bedroom doorway. Their presence is clearly an attempt to create mischief by turning on the light. At this very moment, a stranger, who has gone unnoticed until now, slowly lifts his gaze for the first time. His eyes lock onto Malcolm with an unyielding and intense stare. As the stranger suddenly advances forward into the doorway, Malcolm instinctively stumbles backwards, landing on the edge of the bed in a moment filled with surprise and vulnerability. Anna catches sight of the stranger, and her face instantly loses color in a mix of fear and shock. The stranger's half-grin directed towards Malcolm changes Anna's expression instantaneously. The stranger then fixes a piercing glare at Malcolm, who becomes completely motionless, standing there as if frozen in time. Tears start to cascade down the stranger's face, and Malcolm finds himself looking up at the sound of the stranger's pained and anguished words. Vincent Gray is revealed, staring through a veil of tears, his expression a mixture of surprise and deep-seated anguish. Malcolm exhales deeply, as if he has resurfaced from the depths of an ocean, while Vincent's eyes blaze with a fiery intensity at Malcolm, who is now crying fully. Vincent turns towards a nearby sink, reaches in with a decisive motion, and abruptly turns around, raising a gun menacingly at Malcolm before firing. Malcolm, struck by the bullet, clutches his stomach and collapses onto the bed like a limp rag doll. In an instant, Vincent shifts the gun to his own head in a desperate move. Later on, as Malcolm sifts through a file, he finds every line densely packed with handwritten notes, with various words and phrases prominently circled and highlighted throughout the document. Seated on a sidewalk bench, facing a picturesque row of brownstone homes across the street, Malcolm stares vacantly at the brownstones until the sound of a door opening draws him out of his trance. This sound captures his attention as Cole Sear emerges from his front door, stepping out into the world beyond. Cole, a diminutive boy with strikingly large and dark eyes that seem to absorb everything in their path, possesses dark hair accented with a distinctive small patch of jet white on one side. Carefully locking the door behind him, Cole reaches into his pocket and retrieves an oversized pair of glasses. When he slips them on, they appear almost comically large for his face. Malcolm rises to his feet with intent, but as he looks up, he finds that Cole seems to have vanished. Malcolm barely catches a fleeting glimpse of the boy as Cole dashes away at an impressive speed down the street, disappearing around the corner. With a sense of urgency, Malcolm hastily stuffs the file into his bag and takes off running, sprinting down the sidewalk with determination. He comes to an abrupt halt at a street intersection, just as Cole races across an empty lot, making his way rapidly toward the doors of a nearby building.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: Malcolm reaches out and points to the large framed certificate that is carefully placed on a dining room chair, noticing its elegant presentation on aged parchment-style paper and enclosed within a polished mahogany frame that gives it an air of significance. As he observes this, he methodically slips on his sweatshirt, feeling the fabric against his skin, while simultaneously drawing Anna's attention to the certificate. Her gaze gradually shifts towards the framed document, prompting her to lean forward in her seat, her eyes scanning the text as she adjusts her position to read it aloud, her voice breaking the silence. Meanwhile, Malcolm playfully tries to tickle her, his fingers moving in a teasing manner, which causes Anna to momentarily pause before she completes reading. She then turns her head to look at Malcolm, noticing the warm, inviting smile on his face. Anna reaches out, gently taking Malcolm's hands, holding them steady in a gesture of affection and support, before slowly letting go, her eyes brimming with emotion as if filled with unspoken words. She leans closer to him, and they embrace tightly, their arms wrapping around each other as if to capture the moment forever, their sweet laughter resonating throughout the house, creating an atmosphere of joy and intimacy. In the midst of their shared laughter, the shadows of two giggling figures appear in the bedroom doorway, their outlines faintly visible as they make an attempt to turn on the light. At that moment, a stranger who has been unnoticed until now slowly lifts his head, his eyes meeting Malcolm's, abruptly drawing Malcolm's attention. The stranger moves forward into the doorway with sudden intent, causing Malcolm to instinctively retreat, stumbling back onto the edge of the bed, taken by surprise. Anna, catching sight of the stranger for the first time, reacts with shock, her face turning pale as the situation registers. The stranger fixes his gaze on Malcolm, offering a half grin that seems to carry a hidden meaning, while Anna's expression shifts in response, reflecting a mix of emotions. As tension fills the room, the stranger turns his piercing gaze towards Malcolm, immobilizing him, and causing Malcolm to halt all movement and stand frozen in the moment. Tears begin to streak down the stranger's face, his emotions laid bare, as Malcolm is drawn out of his thoughts by the sound that accompanies those words. Vincent Gray, the stranger, stares intently through his tears, his surprise evident, as Malcolm exhales deeply, as though he has just surfaced from depths of intense pressure, and finds himself caught in the fiery intensity of Vincent's teary eyes, now fully crying. Vincent turns away, his hand reaching into the sink, moving with mechanical precision as he turns back around, raising a gun with deliberate intent at Malcolm. In a swift, irrevocable action, he fires the weapon, the sound echoing through the space, and Malcolm, clutching his stomach in pain, collapses onto the bed, his body limp like a rag doll. Vincent, as if on autopilot, instantly redirects the gun towards his own head, a haunting conclusion to his sudden actions. Elsewhere, handwritten notes densely populate each line, forming a cluttered canvas of thoughts, as Malcolm scans through the page, taking in the words and phrases that have been emphatically circled throughout the file, their significance dawning on him. Seated on a sidewalk bench, he faces a row of brownstone homes lined up across the street, his gaze blankly fixed on them until the sound of a door opening snaps him out of his contemplative state. His attention shifts as he watches Cole Sear emerge from his front door, the sight of the boy bringing a new focus to Malcolm. Cole, small in stature with large, expressive black eyes that seem to absorb every detail around him, stands out with his dark hair accented by a striking patch of jet white on the side. He listens to the quiet clicks as he carefully locks the door behind him, ensuring it's secure, before reaching into his pocket. From it, he retrieves and slips on an oversized pair of glasses that humorously exaggerate his features. Malcolm rises from the bench, preparing to approach, but as he looks up again, Cole has vanished, almost as if he were never there. With only a brief sighting of the boy as Cole sprints away, his legs carrying him at full speed down the street before rounding a corner, Malcolm reacts quickly. Stuffing the file hastily into his bag, he begins to run too, charging down the sidewalk with urgency, his feet pounding against the pavement until he is forced to stop abruptly at a street intersection. Glancing up, he catches sight of Cole sprinting across the empty lot, the boy's destination clear as he reaches the doors of a building, his movement a blur of determination.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: Malcolm gestures toward a large, framed certificate made of aged parchment and housed in polished mahogany, while slipping on a sweatshirt. Anna's attention shifts to the certificate, and she leans forward to read it aloud. As Malcolm playfully tries to tickle her, Anna turns to him, holding his hands briefly before they both share an emotional embrace filled with laughter. In the bedroom doorway, two figures appear, trying to turn on the light, when a stranger apprehends Malcolm with his gaze. The stranger advances, forcing Malcolm to stumble onto the bed's edge as Anna notices him, her face paling. The stranger exchanges a glare with Malcolm, causing him to freeze, and tears well up in the stranger's eyes. As Malcolm perceives Vincent Gray's intense stare through his tears, Vincent suddenly retrieves a gun from the sink, turns, and shoots Malcolm, who collapses onto the bed. Vincent then turns the gun on himself. Malcolm later reviews a page filled with circled notes and phrases. Sitting on a park bench, he stares blankly at a row of brownstones until a door opens, catching his attention as Cole Sear steps out. Cole, a small boy with large, observant eyes and distinctive hair, locks the door, dons oversized glasses, and disappears when Malcolm rises. Malcolm spots Cole sprinting away and follows, racing down the sidewalk before halting at an intersection as Cole reaches a building across an empty lot.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description:
Malcolm points to the huge framed certificate propped up on a dining room chair, which is printed on aged parchment-type paper, reminiscent of documents used in prestigious academic institutions, and housed in a polished mahogany frame known for its durability and classic elegance. He slips on the sweatshirt, a comfy old garment from his college days, as Anna's attention slowly moves to the framed certificate. She leans forward in her seat, reads the certificate out loud with a voice full of curiosity while Malcolm, in a playful mood, tries to tickle her, and then turns to Malcolm, who smiles warmly, reminiscent of shared moments of joy. Anna takes Malcolm's hands, which are rough from years spent in his profession, and holds them steady, then lets go, her eyes emotional, filled with memories of their shared history. Anna leans towards him, and they hold each other tight as their sweet laughter, a melody echoing love and companionship, fills the house. 

Two giggling shadows, the playful spirits of children, appear in the bedroom doorway, trying to turn on the light, when a stranger slowly looks up for the first time, his eyes locking on Malcolm like a hunter spotting his prey. The stranger suddenly moves forward into the doorway, causing Malcolm to stumble back onto the edge of the bed, a familiar piece of their shared sanctuary. Anna sees the stranger for the first time, her face draining of color, as though confronted with a ghost from a haunting past. The stranger looks at Malcolm, half grins, as Anna's expression instantly changes, shifting from curiosity to terror. The stranger turns and glares at Malcolm, who stops all movement and stands, frozen by the weight of the moment. Tears fall down the stranger's face, each drop a story untold, as Malcolm looks up at the sound of those words, and Vincent Gray, a figure from Malcolm's bygone days, stares with surprise through his tears. Malcolm lets out a deep breath, like he just emerged from deep waters, a survivor of his own demons, as Vincent's eyes burn at Malcolm, fully crying now. Vincent turns to the sink, a mundane object now part of a tragic scene, his hand goes in, and he turns around, raises a gun at Malcolm, and fires. Malcolm clutches his stomach, feeling a sharp, burning pain, and folds like a rag doll onto the bed, and Vincent instantly moves the gun to his own head, an act of despair and finality. Handwritten notes fill every line as Malcolm, overwhelmed by the chaos, glances through the page and sees words and phrases circled throughout the file, evidence of a life dissected and analyzed.

Sitting on a sidewalk bench facing a row of brownstone homes, iconic of urban architectural beauty and history, across the street, Malcolm gazes blankly at the brownstones until a door opens, bringing him out of his trance as Cole Sear steps out of his front door. Cole is a munchkin of a boy with large, black eyes that seem to take in everything around him, his hair dark with a small patch of jet white on the side, a striking feature that sets him apart. Cole carefully locks the door behind him, a practice of caution beyond his years, reaches into his pocket, and slips on a pair of very large glasses that look comical on him, yet hint at his unique personality. Malcolm rises to his feet, but when he looks up, Cole is gone, like a fleeting shadow in the twilight. Malcolm barely catches a glimpse of the boy as Cole runs at full speed down the street and turns the corner, his footsteps echoing against the city's heartbeat. Stuffing the file, a testament to unresolved mysteries, in his bag, Malcolm starts running too, hauling down the sidewalk, and comes to a hard stop at a street intersection as Cole sprints across the empty lot, reaching the doors of a building that looks as imposing as an institution of secrets.

Handwritten notes fill every line as Malcolm glances through the page and sees words and phrases circled throughout the file. Sitting on a sidewalk bench facing a row of brownstone homes across the street. Malcolm gazes blankly at the brownstones until a door opens bringing him out of his trance as Cole Sear steps out of his front door. Cole is a munchkin of a boy with large black eyes that seem to take in everything around him his hair dark with a small patch of jet white on the side. Cole carefully locks the door behind him reaches into his pocket and slips on a pair of very large glasses that look comical on him. Malcolm rises to his feet but when he looks up Cole is gone. Malcolm barely catches a glimpse of the boy as Cole runs at full speed down the street and turns the corner. Stuffing the file in his bag. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. Malcolm let us out a deep breath like he just emerged from deep waters as Vincent's eyes burn at Malcolm fully crying. now Vincent turns to the sink. his hand goes in and he turns around raises a gun at Malcolm and fires. Malcolm clutches his stomach and folds like a rag doll onto the bed and Vincent instantly moves the gun to his own head. Handwritten notes fill every line as Malcolm glances through the page and sees words and phrases circled throughout the file. Sitting on a sidewalk bench facing a row of brownstone homes across the street. Malcolm gazes blankly at the brownstones until a door opens bringing him out of his trance as Cole Sear steps out of his front door. Cole is a munchkin of a boy with large black eyes that seem to take in everything around him his hair dark with a small patch of jet white on the side. Cole carefully locks the door behind him reaches into his pocket and slips on a pair of very large glasses that look comical on him. Malcolm rises to his feet but when he looks up Cole is gone. Malcolm barely catches a glimpse of the boy as Cole runs at full speed down the street and turns the corner. Stuffing the file in his bag. Malcolm starts running too hauling down the sidewalk and comes to a hard stop at a street intersection as Cole sprints across the empty lot reaching the doors of a building.

He slips on the sweatshirt as Anna's attention slowly moves to the framed certificate. She leans forward in her seat reads the certificate out loud while Malcolm tries to tickle her and then turns to Malcolm who smiles. Anna takes Malcolm's hands and holds them steady. then let us go her eyes emotional. Anna leans towards him and they hold each other tight as their sweet laughter fills the house. Malcolm starts running too hauling down the sidewalk and comes to a hard stop at a street intersection as Cole sprints across the empty lot reaching the doors of a building.

Stuffing the file in his bag. test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Martin signals to the massive quilted tapestry balanced on a kitchen stool, which is scrawled on aged scroll-like fabric and enclosed in a gleaming oak border. He slides into the jacket as Lucy's gaze gradually drifts to the quilted tapestry. She bends closer on her perch, recites the tapestry aloud while Martin attempts to nudge her, and then faces Martin, who chuckles. Lucy grasps Martin's elbows and keeps them still, then releases them, her eyes reflective. Lucy inclines towards him, and they embrace firmly as their gentle chuckles echo through the cottage. Two mirthful silhouettes materialize in the corridor entrance, attempting to activate the fan, when an outsider gradually glances upward for the initial moment, his gaze fixing on Martin. The outsider abruptly advances into the entrance, causing Martin to recoil onto the corner of the couch. Lucy notices the outsider for the first time, her complexion blanching. The outsider peers at Martin, half smirks, as Lucy's demeanor promptly shifts. The outsider pivots and glowers at Martin, who halts all motion and rises. Drops descend from the outsider's cheeks as Martin glances upward at the sound of those phrases, and Victor Jade gazes with astonishment through his sobs. Martin exhales deeply as if he just surfaced from submerged depths as Victor's gaze sears at Martin, fully weeping now. Victor turns to the basin, his palm reaches in, and he pivots around, lifts a slingshot at Martin, and launches. Martin grips his torso and collapses like a limp puppet onto the couch, and Victor immediately directs the slingshot to his own temple. Scribbled annotations cover every margin as Martin scans through the leaflet and discerns words and expressions encircled throughout the manuscript. Perched on a roadside bench facing a series of stone cottages across the avenue, Martin stares vacantly at the cottages until a door swings open, jolting him out of his daze as Charlie Red steps out of his front porch. Charlie is an elf of a lad with expansive, dark eyes that appear to absorb everything around him, his mane dusky with a tiny streak of midnight white on the flank. Charlie meticulously locks the entrance behind him, delves into his pouch, and dons a pair of exceedingly oversized spectacles that appear whimsical on him. Martin rises to his toes, but as he gazes upward, Charlie is vanished. Martin scarcely glimpses the lad as Charlie dashes at top velocity down the boulevard and curves the bend. Stowing the manuscript in his pouch, Martin commences sprinting likewise, rushing down the pavement, and halts abruptly at a crossroad as Charlie streaks across the barren field, arriving at the thresholds of a structure.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Malcolm shows Anna a framed certificate on aged parchment in a polished mahogany frame. Anna reads it aloud, and they share a tender moment. Suddenly, a stranger enters, causing chaos; Malcolm stumbles into a bed, and Anna is shocked. The stranger, Vincent Gray, confronts Malcolm with tears, then unexpectedly shoots him and himself. Malcolm later sits blankly on a bench across from brownstone homes. Cole Sear, a perceptive young boy with distinct black eyes and a patch of white hair, appears. Cole exits his home, locks the door, and dons oversized glasses. Malcolm stands, but Cole disappears, running down the street. Malcolm quickly pursues him, stopping at a street intersection while Cole enters a building.
